page.title: 15Family life in Boutie
page.content: Extrmes of weather and daylight are considerable factorsin daily life on farms in bourtie and keithall/Kinkell. Families who have grown up in the parishes hae one ritual in common a hot midday meal, called dinner. For this reason children who are transported by school bus from rural homes to schools in Oldmeldrum, keithall and Inverurie are also provided with a hot midday meal at school. In winter buses collect children at rural stops at 8 am when it is still dark and deliver them home at 4 pm when again it is dark. By contrast during the summer holiday months it is still light at midnight on June 21st, and one can see to read a book at 10 pm in mid-July. Consequently families spend long winter nights reading and watching television, summer evenings outside.
